channel.title: First over the counter HIV test
channel.description:
http://news.yahoo.com/first-over-counter-hiv-test-approved-180808349.html
I don't know why such a thing would be popular, although, there wasn't any indication it'd be :| Also, I first saw this on fox news when I was channel surfing.

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

mopman_sucks:

However a part of me feels that if you have something as deadly as HIV it should be public record similar to the Sex Offender list.

Terrible idea, because of multiple reasons:

Greeny:

Except in first world countries HIV is no longer quite such a deadly disease, if you find you have it early you can have it under control in no time and live a relatively normal life.

And:

Mopman:

yes, thats what we need to do, push it more underground by treating people like lepers

Besides, getting HIV infected is partially your own fault. Having sex with someone you barely know, or who isn’t someone you have sex with on a regular basis (both are fine by me), is something you should do with protection. No protection, no sex.

A lot of people still think HIV and AIDS patients are disgusting. You don’t want to isolate these people, they are still capable members of society.

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

considering the fact that knowingly passing an std on without telling the person you have an std is a criminal offense in most countries I think a public list would serve no purpose other than invading peoples privacy

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Most likely reason HIV is on a raise is because the world is getting dumber and have sex with to many hookers and people who were stupid enough to believe their boy/girl friend that they didn’t have sex with someone else who has HIV.

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Mopman:

yes, thats what we need to do, push it more underground by treating people like lepers

That’s a question of if the person with HIV is responsible enough to tell partners that if they have the disease before hand.

I’m all for it, don’t get me wrong. But I think it’s weird because now that it’s an over the counter test I see it as a more common thing now as to my old idea that it was an uncommon disease. The public option to utilize the test doesn’t solidify a solid chance that it will be more common but its interesting that now its just more publicly accessible.

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test

item.description:

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:448436”]yes, thats what we need to do, push it more underground by treating people like lepers[/quote]That worked well back in the early 1900’s!

item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

sinisoul:

Alright, points seen. I was kind of hung over on the fact like Silab said, if you have HIV I think there should be a registry since it is such a deadly disease that can be passed anonymously without the other person knowing. So countering my original thoughts, it’d be really popular. But not so much. Considering I can’t see that many people testing themselves since I thought it was a rare thing to begin with.

Except in first world countries HIV is no longer quite such a deadly disease, if you find you have it early you can have it under control in no time and live a relatively normal life. So the need for a registry? IMO, no. I think you could say the same for any chronic infectious disease otherwise.

This test is great news though.

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

HIV seems to be on the rise, it’s becoming common in adolescents too.

Here’s a chart it’s from 2009 though so it’s probably a bit outdated, but it should give you a good idea
http://www.cdc.gov/hiv/youth/

AVERT – 21 Jul 15

HIV and AIDS in the United States of America (USA)

USA HIV statistics. The USA is a major contributor to funding the global HIV response, yet it also has its own significant epidemic to address. 

Read full topic

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

sinisoul:

I don’t know why such a thing would be popular

Because people who have had unprotected sex have worries. And it probably wouldn’t go on document, which leads me to another point which is privacy concern.

t4:

i’m assuming it’s inexpensive (some people don’t have health-care)

Relatively inexpensive, although the accuracy rating could be better.
http://slatest.slate.com/posts/2012/05/16/over_the_counter_hiv_test_fda_may_approve_cheap_new_home_hiv_test_.html

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

With a 92% accuracy rating I don’t think it is good enough to just call yourself safe immediatly.

Read full topic

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

sinisoul:

I don’t know why such a thing would be popular

don’t have to go to doctors
don’t have to have it on record
don’t have to be embarrassed
i’m assuming it’s inexpensive (some people don’t have health-care)

… list goes on

Read full topic
item.source: First over the counter HIV test

item.title: First over the counter HIV test
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:1, topic:448436”]http://news.yahoo.com/first-over-counter-hiv-test-approved-180808349.html

I don’t know why such a thing would be popular, although, there wasn’t any indication it’d be Also, I first saw this on fox news when I was channel surfing.[/quote]
you don’t know why such a thing would be popular?

its the same reason a home pregnancy test is popular, its a privacy concern even more so when it comes to something like HIV. Personally I think this absolutely fantastic as more people are going to start testing themselves. However a part of me feels that if you have something as deadly as HIV it should be public record similar to the Sex Offender list.

however in the united states it will never happen.

Read full topic
